title: Exoterra Gaming
highlights: Worked as a developer for the community and its servers
Iterated through various design changes with testers to ensure functional and quality content
Participated in the ideation phase to construct unique ideas for the servers to utilize
details: This gaming community is where I truly fell in love with game development. The primary developer for the community took me under his wing, allowing me to learn more about programming by working alongside me.

While I started with fairly simple changes, lots of oversight, and limited access to the source code, over time, I was granted full access to the servers and source code, permission to make changes without seeking specific approvals, and even given my own server to make my own. I proved myself trustworthy and invaluable to the community, and worked with them until the community unfortunately shut down.

At its peak, our community's Jailbreak server was the most popular Jailbreak server on Garry's Mod. Even when other competition popped up, we were still consistently able to maintain activity for the majority of the server's lifetime.

title: Exoterra Jailbreak
highlights: Created new features for an existing codebase on a Jailbreak server
Worked with another developer to update, modernize, and beautify old code to work for our needs
Updated a logs addon to work with Jailbreak
Note, due to the community shutting down and its age, much of this code and content is lost to time. Selections can be found below, but it is not an all encompassing summary.

title: National Honor Society / Key Club
highlights: Led as the NHS President and Key Club Vice President during my final year
Managed a team of 60+ students to identify, plan, and implement volunteer projects
Organized and managed 20+ volunteer events our members could attend
Tracked our members' attendance throughout the year to ensure everyone was on track to meet their membership requirements
details: I volunteered for these groups for as long as I was able to - a total of 2.5 years for NHS, and roughly 4 for Key Club. Throughout my tenure, I participated in numerous volunteering activities in an effort to give back to my community.

In my senior year, I wanted to step up and lead the clubs that I had participated in for such a long time. I was elected president in NHS, and Vice-President in Key Club. In these positions, I came up with ideas for new volunteering events, rekindled relationships with existing partners, and conducted administrative tasks for the clubs.

In particular, while President of NHS, I created a specialized spreadsheet to track the event completions and hours of work done by each member. Our club had a specific hour requirement for members, and previously, the teacher advisor had to keep track of them on paper, causing students who weren't sure exactly how many hours they had to have to ask her, and creating a large area of possible data loss. With the spreadsheet, I made it as easy as possible for anyone to enter in the data, created a view into the data for students to track their progress, and made it easy for the teacher advisor to monitor the students' progress to completing all requirements.

title: Sound Engineer
highlights: Worked on live performances and educational talks to ensure sound quality and audibility throughout the space
Responsible for stage setup, performance, and teardown
Remained focused in the high pressure, live environment
details: Being someone who was in love with technology, I jumped at the opportunity to volunteer with the sound systems that my school used for weeklky events. As one of the  'sound engineers', I ensured that the performers on stage were always able to be heard throughout the space. This required me learning about sound mixing, multiple pieces of new hardware/technology I had never used before, and solve problems as they came up. I was able to flourish in this environment, and continued doing it until I graduated.
